intro: Aconogonon angustifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaf aconogonon, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, strap-like leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in summer. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens for its attractive foliage and delicate blooms.
